content:
The equivalent molar ratios of two metal nitrates [5.0 mL of Ni(NO3)2 (0.50 mmol) + 5 mL of Mn(NO3)2 (0.50 mmol)] in the presence of iron (III) nitrate nonahydrate as catalyst were dissolved in 10.0 mL of distilled water, next pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid (167 mg, 1.00 mmol) and an aqua solution (2.0 mL) of NaOH (80 mg, 2.0 mmol) were added gutty to this solution. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. Solution filtered off and left to evaporate at room temperature. After 5 days, green crystals of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n were formed 57 % yield based on metal nitrates. Anal. Cal. for C14 H6 Ni N2Mn O10: C, 35.29; H, 1.26; N, 5.88 Found: C, 35.06; H, 1.01; N, 5.73.

Sonochemical Synthesis of [Ni(dipic)<sub>2</sub>Mn(O)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>n</sub>

For preparation the polymer of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n, 10 mL aqueous solution of nickel (II) nitrate hexahydrate (0.1 M) and manganese(II) nitrate tetrahydrate (0.1 M) in the presence of iron (III) nitrate nonahydrate as catalyst, under the ultrasonic irradiation, (10 mL) aqueous solution of pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid (0.2 M) and (10 mL) of sodium hydroxide (0.4 M) were added gutty under high-density ultrasonic probe, operating at 20 kHz with a maximum power output of 300 W for 1 h. Solution filtered off and left to evaporate at room temperature. After 5 days green crystals of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n were formed 57 % yield based on metal nitrates. Anal. Cal. for C14 H6 Ni N2Mn O10: C, 35.29; H, 1.26; N, 5.88 Found: C, 35.21; H, 1.12; N, 5.74.
clean_text:
Synthesis Single Crystal of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n by Reflux

The equivalent molar ratios of two metal nitrates [5.0 mL of Ni(NO3)2 (0.50 mmol) + 5 mL of Mn(NO3)2 (0.50 mmol)] in the presence of iron (III) nitrate nonahydrate as catalyst were dissolved in 10.0 mL of distilled water, next pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid (167 mg, 1.00 mmol) and an aqua solution (2.0 mL) of NaOH (80 mg, 2.0 mmol) were added gutty to this solution. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. Solution filtered off and left to evaporate at room temperature. After 5 days, green crystals of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n were formed 57 % yield based on metal nitrates. Anal. Cal. for C14 H6 Ni N2Mn O10: C, 35.29; H, 1.26; N, 5.88 Found: C, 35.06; H, 1.01; N, 5.73.

Sonochemical Synthesis of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n

For preparation the polymer of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n, 10 mL aqueous solution of nickel (II) nitrate hexahydrate (0.1 M) and manganese(II) nitrate tetrahydrate (0.1 M) in the presence of iron (III) nitrate nonahydrate as catalyst, under the ultrasonic irradiation, (10 mL) aqueous solution of pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid (0.2 M) and (10 mL) of sodium hydroxide (0.4 M) were added gutty under high-density ultrasonic probe, operating at 20 kHz with a maximum power output of 300 W for 1 h. Solution filtered off and left to evaporate at room temperature. After 5 days green crystals of [Ni(dipic)2Mn(O)2]n were formed 57 % yield based on metal nitrates. Anal. Cal. for C14 H6 Ni N2Mn O10: C, 35.29; H, 1.26; N, 5.88 Found: C, 35.21; H, 1.12; N, 5.74.
